# This Python 3 environment comes with many helpful analytics libraries installed
# It is defined by the kaggle/python Docker image: https://github.com/kaggle/docker-python
# For example, here's several helpful packages to load

import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import plotly.express as px
import seaborn as sns
import plotly.graph_objects as go
import plotly.offline as py


# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

# You can write up to 5GB to the current directory (/kaggle/working/) that gets preserved as output when you create a version using "Save & Run All" 
# You can also write temporary files to /kaggle/temp/, but they won't be saved outside of the current session

df = pd.read_excel('/kaggle/input/pizza-and-cool-drinks-sales-in-zimbabwe/Pizza and Cool Drinks sales in Zimbabwe.xlsx')
df.head()
source.4fad9c64:
# categorical features
categorical_feat = [feature for feature in df.columns if df[feature].dtypes=='O']
print('Total categorical features: ', len(categorical_feat))
print('\n',categorical_feat)
source.c3a44d2e:
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder
categorical_col = ('Description', 'Department')
        
        
for col in categorical_col:
    label = LabelEncoder() 
    label.fit(list(df[col].values)) 
    df[col] = label.transform(list(df[col].values))

print('Shape all_data: {}'.format(df.shape))
source.37c0fac7:
plt.figure(figsize = (10,6))
sns.lineplot(data=df, x="Sales Incl VAT", y="Sales Excl VAT", color='r', marker='*')
plt.title("Sales Incl VAT & Sales Excl VAT",fontweight='bold',size=20)
plt.xlabel('Sales Incl VAT',size=15)
plt.ylabel('Sales Excl VAT',size=15)
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.show()
source.e2782c34:
plt.figure(figsize = (10,6))
sns.lineplot(data=df, x="Description", y="QTY Sold", color='b', marker='*')
plt.title("Description & QTY Sold",fontweight='bold',size=20)
plt.xlabel('Description',size=15)
plt.ylabel('QTY Sold',size=15)
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.show()

#https://www.kaggle.com/olgabelitskaya/parts-of-speech
plt.figure(figsize=(10,5))
sns.countplot(y="Department",data=df,
             facecolor=(0,0,0,0),linewidth=5,
             edgecolor=sns.color_palette("winter"))
plt.title('Cool Drinks in Zimbabwe',
         fontsize=15);

#Code by Ashaab Rizvi https://www.kaggle.com/ashaabrizvi/fifa-eda-seaborn/notebook

plt.figure(dpi=125)
x=df.head(20)['Description']
y=df.head(20)['Profit']

sns.regplot(x,y)
plt.title('Drinks description & Profit')
plt.xlabel('Description')
plt.ylabel('Profit')
plt.show()
source.164202ad:
#Code by Ashaab Rizvi https://www.kaggle.com/ashaabrizvi/covid-19-plotly-tutorial
# Scatter Plot in Plotly
fig = go.Figure(data=go.Scatter(x=df['Description'],y=df['QTY Sold'],mode='markers',marker=dict(size=10,color=df['Sales Incl VAT'],showscale=True),text=df['Sales Excl VAT']))
fig.update_layout(title='Cool Drinks in Zimbabwe',xaxis_title='Description',yaxis_title='QTY Sold')

fig.show()
source.a1d756f0:
#Code by Ashaab Rizvi https://www.kaggle.com/ashaabrizvi/fifa-eda-seaborn/notebook

sns.relplot(x='Description',y='Gross Profit%',hue='Profit',palette = 'viridis',size="Contribution to turnover%", sizes=(15, 200),aspect=2.5,data=df)
plt.title('Cool Drinks in Zimbabwe',fontsize = 20)
plt.xlabel('Description')
plt.ylabel('Gross Profit%')
plt.show()
